books.title: The Man Who Was Thursday
books.author: G. K. Chesterton
books.summary: An undercover policeman infiltrates a mysterious Anarchist group.

books.title: The Sea Hawk
books.author: Rafael Sabatini
books.summary: A Cornish gentleman becomes a Barbary corsair and seeks vengeance on the jealous half brother who betrayed him.

books.title: The Autobiography of John Stuart Mill
books.author: John Stuart Mill
books.summary: The autobiography of English philosopher John Stuart Mill.

books.title: Tombstone
books.author: Walter Noble Burns
books.summary: An embellished retelling of the town of Tombstone, Arizona, during its heyday in the late 19th century, featuring famous heroes and outlaws of the American Old West.

books.title: Black Beauty
books.author: Anna Sewell
books.summary: A memoir narrated by a horse whose idyllic time on an English farm prepares him for a life filled with constant change and varied circumstances.

books.title: The School for Scandal
books.author: Richard Brinsley Sheridan
books.summary: Despite their best efforts, the rumormongers of 18th-century London are disappointed by their targets.

books.title: Henry VI, Part I
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: King Henry VI takes the throne during a time of great political division: the quarreling among English noblemen and the collapse of England’s hold in France.

books.title: The Story of the Amulet
books.author: E. Nesbit
books.summary: Four children are reunited with an ancient, magical creature and go on adventures through time with a magic amulet.

books.title: A Farewell to Arms
books.author: Ernest Hemingway
books.summary: An ambulance lieutenant and a field nurse have an affair during World War I.

books.title: The Beetle
books.author: Richard Marsh
books.summary: A group of middle-class Victorians find themselves pitted against an ancient Egyptian evil.

books.title: Twelve Years a Slave
books.author: Solomon Northup
books.summary: The account of a free black man kidnapped in 1841 and sold into slavery, from which it took twelve years to free himself.

books.title: The Memoirs of Sherlock Holmes
books.author: Arthur Conan Doyle
books.summary: The world’s first consulting detective and his companion investigate further crimes and mysteries, culminating in a life-or-death struggle with an evil nemesis.

books.title: A Journal of the Plague Year
books.author: Daniel Defoe
books.summary: An account of one man’s survival in London during the Great Plague of 1665.

books.title: The Social Contract
books.author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau
books.summary: Rousseau explores the political philosophy of authority originating from the consent of the people.

books.title: Eugene Onegin
books.author: Alexander Pushkin
books.summary: A jaded Russian fop’s disdain for the world catches up with him.

books.title: Looking Backward
books.author: Edward Bellamy
books.summary: A man falls asleep in 1887 and wakes up over a century later in a socialist utopia.

books.title: Metropolis
books.author: Thea von Harbou
books.summary: In a futuristic dystopian city, the son of the city’s mastermind falls in love with a revolutionary activist.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Manly Wade Wellman
books.summary: A collection of horror and science fiction stories by Manly Wade Wellman.

books.title: Orthodoxy
books.author: G. K. Chesterton
books.summary: G. K. Chesterton’s unique view on Christianity and how all his “solitary and sincere speculations” were ultimately answered by its theology.

books.title: The Worst Journey in the World
books.author: Apsley Cherry-Garrard
books.summary: The travelogue of a member of Robert Scott’s ill-fated Antarctic expedition of 1910.
